�.�Wow! Look at this place!Ooh, what's that?
1�Tell me everything!
1�Hey, now!This is an ancient ruin you have the privilege to be in. Try not to disturb the--
1�This is my first time in an ancient ruin! It's so exciting!
1�Poor old Tateeya is stuck in the factory all by herself!But lucky me gets to go on a field trip with Mister Ghatsad!
1�Well, I'm glad to see you're taking an interest in the past.
1�But if you keep up that ruckus, who knows what sort of unwanted attention you'll attract?
1�Even with us here to protect you, some monster might snatch you away into the shadows.
1�They've even employed mercenaries from Salaheem's Sentinels to patrol the ruins for dangerous beasts.
1�Many alchemists have fallen prey to the legions of foul creatures that stalk these halls.
1�You know how on moonless nights you can hear the roar of the Cyan Deep echoing through the darkness?
1�That sound is really the wails of those lost alchemists as their spirits roam the ruins in despair...
1�Rishfee!
1�That's quite enough. The poor child is shaking in fear.
1�Is that r-really true?
1�Maybe you'll be the first to find out...
1�Y-you're lying!You're just being a big meanie-weanie!
1�Amnaf. What do you see?
1�Quiet...
1�We're not alone...
1�Hey, it's you!What are you doing down here?
1�If you want to see the ruins, you should come along with us!
1�Ah, yes. Your 3���� marks you plainly.
1�Are you taking care of your automaton?
1�Are you here all by yourself?
1�If you want to see the ruins, you should come along with us!
1�Ah, yes. Your 3���� marks you plainly.
1�I'm assuming this is your first visit to the ruins?Perhaps it would benefit you to join our little tour.
1�Mister Ghatsad was about to tell us about the Alzadaal civilization.These ruins have so many stories!
1�Which part of the ruins do you ask about?The windows.The pillars.The floor.
1�You wish to learn about the windows?
1�Look at those fish swimming around in there!I wonder what would happen if the windows broke!
1�Those fish are actually swimming in the waters of the Cyan Deep. We are currently on the bottom of the ocean, looking out at them.
1�Those windows are under an incredible amount of pressure from the weight of the water. If the windows were to break, I'm afraid we'd be crushed in an instant.
1�What is that sparkling light all over the glass?I've never seen anything like it!
1�That is the glow of plasma oil...
1�Ooh, isn't that the same oil we use in the automatons?
1�That's correct.The windows of these ruins are actually membranes of plasma oil that repel the waters of the sea like giant bubbles.
1�You mean it just bounces off?
1�You could put it that way, yes.But these barriers have been in place for hundreds of years. I highly doubt they'll give way any time soon.
1�A truly astonishing feat of technology.
1�However, the only reason these membranes hold is due to a constant supply of plasma oil.
1�Some day, this supply must run out, and when it does...
1�Are y-you trying to scare me too, Mister Ghatsad?I'm not sure I wanna stay here much longer...
1�Ah, you've touched upon an interesting area.
1�But it is not the shape of the pillars that is so fascinating.
1�Any person with a basic knowledge of archaeology would recognize the graceful conical base and frail-looking central column.
1�This design was often seen in the temples built during the reign of Emperor Alzadaal, some 900 years ago.
1�The fascinating thing about these pillars lies in the construction itself.
1�There are markings that suggest a degree of rotation and elongation is possible...
1�Why would they make a pillar like that?
1�Hmm, I wonder the same thing.
1�I theorize that the architects of this structure wanted to incorporate a level of flexibility to compensate for the changes in water pressure...
1�That's pretty clever...
1�Should these technological marvels be understood in the near future, I hope to adapt their use to the field of automaton construction...
1�Mister Ghatsad!
1�I'm gonna work real hard on my studies so I can help you!
1�The floor?Yes, it really is quite fascinating.
1�Ooh, I wanted to hear about this!
1�The elegant mosaics on the floor are designed with several different varieties of stones... One might say that these designs are symbolic of the prosperity of the Alzadaal Dynasty.
1�It's a shame we've lost so many of the arts of that age...
1�What about this shining symbol on the floor over here?
1�I'm sure I've seen this design somewhere before...
1�Dum-dee-dum-dee-dum...
1�That is a transport device not unlike the runic portals currently employed by the Empire.
1�The Aht Urhgan Archaeological Research Institute has deemed these devices safe for use in their continuing investigations.
1�Hmmm...Dum-dee-dum-dee-dum...So they still work even after 900 years?
1�Yes.A curious fact.
1�The A.A.R.I. has been diligent in its efforts to remove all traces of dust and grime as they work through the ruins, but have not attempted any maintenance.
1�There simply hasn't been a need.
1�It's as if these ruins have been frozen in time...
1�Not merely in appearance, but in all of its functions.
1�I love mysteries!
1�I bet the ruins were just waiting for us to rediscover them!
1�You could be right, Abda-Lurabda...
1�I think that's enough for one day.Time to return to the workshop.
1�What? Already?We just got here!
1�We can't have poor Tateeya mind the place all by herself, now can we?
1�I suppose not...But you'll bring me here again, right?
1�I promise.
1�Rishfee, would you mind escorting young Abda-Lurabda back to Al Zahbi?

1�It has all unfolded just as the Grand Vizier predicted.
1�And so you have come...
1�A pity.I always respected you,  , but such are the twists of fate.

1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Astral Waves.Transformations(pt.1).Transformations(pt.2).Transformations(pt.3).Transformations(pt.4).Path of Darkness.Fangs of the Lion.Nashmeira's Plea(pt.1).Nashmeira's Plea(pt.2).Ragnarok.Forging a New Myth.Waking the Colossus(pt.1).Waking the Colossus(pt.2).Divine Interference(pt.1).Divine Interference(pt.2).From the Ruins(pt.1).From the Ruins(pt.2).Rhapsodies of Vana'diel.

1�Thank goodness you've arrived.
1�This building--and those like it scattered throughout the land--are historic ruins of the great Alzadaal Dynasty, which flourished over 900 years ago.
1�Only under the most special of circumstances are those not from our lands permitted entry.
1�I'm afraid I cannot explain more at present, but this edifice is related to the prime avatar spoken of in Aht Urhganian legends.
1�  and I would surely like to hear more about what exactly this prime avatar is.
1�In simple terms...an iron giant.
1�An iron giant!?
1�Its name is Alexander--a being that commands the forces light.
h?�How is
--�What on Vana'diel...
1�Ah, Phoenix. Thy voice always grated on mine ears.
1�Oho. But 'twould seem thou art even more cacophonous than usual. Perhaps because now there are two of thee.
1�Ah, so one carrying thy blessing has alighted on this land from the future.
1�I understand thy predicament.
1�If thou dost deem her to be of great importance, then I shall honor thy request to give her form in this world once more.
1�Lady Iroh
a!�Master...Sir Tenzen...
1�How do you react?Iroha! Are you...How do you feel?I thought you had been killed!
1�Lady Iroha, your journey to the realm of the living has surely taken its toll. Permit me to explain in your stead.
1�None understand better than I.
1�Phoenix has become whole in the future, and its life force has brought Iroha back to us.
1�Yet this is not the first time, and gods strike me if it is the last.
1�She is stuck within the cycle of life, returning to Vana'diel each time she is struck down.
1�Would that I were not endlessly reliant on my family to rescue me after each mishap...
1�My blade once held power of a similar magnitude, so I am all too familiar with the particulars.
1�Yet just as flame can cauterize a grievous wound, so too are Phoenix's blazing wings of life accompanied by indelible pain. Am I wrong?
1�There is no need to put on a brave front. Though your body may have recovered, your spirit yet needs time to heal.
1�There is naught else for me to do...
1�That girl's presence in this world is forbidden, and is why death doth clamor to claim her at every opportunity.
1�Forbidden...?
1�Doubtless because she has not yet been born.
1�Order must be obeyed, and all that would threaten it shall be expunged.
1�Even Phoenix can only protect her for so long. Its breath draws ever fainter, its energies beginning to wane.
1�I have done what I can, but whether she is long for this world is not something for me to decide.
1�I care not what hardships I must overcome. Master must bring light to my future, and my calling is to guide �[him/her] along the path.
1�And thou wilt stop at naught to banish the Emptiness.
1�Yet the Emptiness bringeth absolute darkness; it is not the absence of light I shall face  [in the end/when Ragnarok cometh].
1�The spirits of eld have surely felt the presence of such an abomination since time immemorial.
1�It surpasses the power of the gods themselves, and shall descend upon Vana'diel ere long.
1�And its underlings have already arrived in our time.
1�Lord Alexander, they aimed to engage in a ritual with the Astral Candescence and use it to steal your power.
1�Ah yes, I recall the Candescence.
1�But thou art slightly mistaken. They were not after my light, but rather Odin's darkness.
1�Of course, it is only via my form that they would be able to summon Odin.
1�But that would call forth �[/ another] Ragnarok!
1�I would relish such a test of wills.
1� �[No!/You can't--!]
1�Fear not, youngling. They scattered as chaff before the wind.
1�What concerneth me now is whether they will attempt to clip Phoenix's wings again...
1�...or whether they will search for their darkness elsewhere.
1�Thank goodness you've arrived.
1�This building--and those like it scattered throughout the land--are historic ruins of the great Alzadaal Dynasty, which flourished over 900 years ago.
1�Only under the most special of circumstances are those not from our lands permitted entry.
